name: Gingerbread Cookie
effect: Destroy Gingerbread Cookie ==> Each hero heals 7 damage from itself.
"Fresh from our farm to your plate, it's Smookywood Pastures's wholesome goodness!"

name: Great-father Winter
effect: 0 ==> Target player gains control of target ability, ally, or equipment you control. Use only once per turn.
"Mmmm . . . Gingerbread cookies and milk!"

name: Greatfather Winter
effect: 0 ==> Put a card from your hand into target player's hand. Use only once per turn. (He owns that card for the rest of the game.)
"You're quite the helper to ol' Greatfather Winter."

name: Hardpacked Snowball
effect:
Attach to target hero or ally and exhaust it.
Ongoing: Attached character can't attack or protect and has "[Activate] ==> Attach Hardpacked Snowball to target hero or ally and exhaust it."
Throw me!

name: Metzen the Reindeer
effect:
Elusive
When Metzen enters play, target opponent puts three Pirate ally tokens with 1 ATK / 1 health into play.
[Activate] ==> Ready target hero or ally. Use only if no Pirates are in play.
"I hate to think of what those cruel thugs might do to him..." - Kaymard Copperpinch

name: Mistletoe
effect: You and another friendly player each exhaust your heroes ==> You and that player each draw a card.
Smooch!

name: PX-238 Winter Wondervolt
effect:
Choose an ally type.
Ongoing: All allies also have that type. (Examples of types are Chicken, Demon, Druid, Gnome, and Yeti.)
"You mean there's a setting to this thing other than 'gnome'?"

name: The Abominable Greench
effect: If an opponent would draw a card, you draw one instead.
He's a mean one . . .

name: The Reason for the Season
effect:
During your turn, pay 3 to complete this quest.
Reward: Draw a card. If it's December, draw another card.
"As Greatfather Winter walked Azeroth, bringing winter in his wake, it was said he would provide a bounty for those who welcomed his presence." - The Feast of Winter Veil

name: Treats for Great-father Winter
effect:
Pay 3 to complete this quest.
Reward: Draw a card. Then, you may discard a Gingerbread Cookie card. If you do, search your deck for a Feast of Winter Veil card, reveal it, and put it into your hand.
"Here's a little somethingâ€¦you know, for the effort." - Great-father Winter
